snippet: At least 46 people were killed in recent days in clashes among the Libyan branch of the Islamic State, a rival Islamist group and forces loyal to the internationally recognized government in two Libyan cities, residents and medics say.
abstract: Internationally recognized government of Libya, temporarily based in cities of Tobruk and Bayda, asks other Arab states to conduct airstrikes against Islamic State positions in coastal city of Surt.
lead_paragraph: At least 46 people were killed in recent days in clashes among the Libyan branch of the Islamic State, a rival Islamist group and forces loyal to the internationally recognized government in two Libyan cities, residents and medics say.

headline.main: Libya Seeks Airstrikes Against ISIS Branch
headline.print_headline: Libya Seeks Airstrikes Against ISIS Branch

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
